intro: Caiophora taraxacoides, commonly known as the yellow starwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and prefers well-drained soils. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy seed heads. Caiophora taraxacoides is often found in open areas and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
